title: The Comparison Page
subtitle: Comparing cryptocurrency market prices across exchanges
body:
When using InterTrader, if you're not searching for profitable trades , a lot of your time will be spent on the comparison page, where you can see:

  • Prices of a cryptocurrency pair across multiple exchanges
  • Potential profit
  • Orderbooks from the exchanges where the coin is listed

Price chart

The prominent bar chart on the comparison page provides a quick overview of the buy and sell price across all the exchanges for which InterTrader has coin pair data.

Price analysis

Tapping Bitcoin icon in the nav bar displays the price analysis summary for the coin pair. This is the buy/sell price information described in the search and analysis guide. If there is potential profit to be earned, it is displayed here.

Exchange details

Below the bar chart are the numerical buy and sell prices for each exchange. You'll also find the coin name, where available, so you can more easily determine if the coins sharing the same ticker are being compared.

The quality of information returned from each exchange varies considerably. For this reason, the ticker symbol is the most reliable way to match and compare coins â€” but it isn't perfect. Make sure you verify that you're not trying to intertrade two different coins.

Orderbook

Tap the list icon for each exchange to see their orderbooks. InterTrader returns the last five buy and sell orders so that you can more quickly determine if there is enough supply and demand to make a profitable trade.

NOTE: Some exchanges don't provide a way to retrieve orderbook data, so the list icon will not appear.

Performing calculations

For convenience there is a cost calculator available when viewing the exchange details or the orderbook.

To open the calculator for a particular exchange:

Tap and hold on one of the exchange details boxes and the calculator will open. The price will be pre-populated but is also editable. Use the Buy/Sell option to switch between the buy and sell price. Enter a quantity to find out what it would cost at the specified price.

To open the calculator for an orderbook order:

Tap any of the numeric values in the table to open the calculator for that row. The price, quantity and total will all be pre-populated, but only the price and quantity remain editable.

NOTE: You can't change the Buy/Sell option on the orderbook.
